body: HI @ldavr "I first see the message in the terminal that data and video length does not match, which results in off-set tracklets in the GUI:" --> could you please triple check you load the correct video, otherwise this will occur, namely it should be the same raw video that you pass for video_analysis :).
Hi @MMathisLab . Triple checked twice right now just to be sure, and it is the same raw video that I load with the pickle-file for the model chosen for analysis (ellipse).

thanks for checking; can you confirm what these values are?, i.e. which pickle file you are loading (and then confirm you click "step 1" before you launch optional refinement? 

![Screen Shot 2021-05-05 at 2 46 23 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/117144206-f4095100-adb1-11eb-8cf0-62deffd58310.png)

Absolutely. Here are the values:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47774575/117151438-5dd92900-adb9-11eb-9551-3302e7e81203.png)

And confirmed that Step 1: Create tracks was clicked before Refinement:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47774575/117151526-777a7080-adb9-11eb-9a08-87b44cc54433.png)

Okay great, that looks correct ... 

just to confirm, as it's an older project; you first re-trained a new shuffle within 2.2rc1 (i.e. shuffle 2 I gather)?

and, sorry, just to be extra sure, you have these files for this (your) video?
![Screen Shot 2021-05-05 at 3 55 39 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/117152569-6e3dd380-adba-11eb-81dd-79582aa47108.png)

It is very good that you are extra sure and are double confirming, these details are typical to be the reason for issues like this :) 

Correct, it was retrained for 60 000 iterations (shuffle 2, as you correctly gathered) using the GUI.

Indeed, these are all the files connected to this video:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47774575/117153501-5450c080-adbb-11eb-93c7-d6cddf4cb09a.png)
@Idavr, if you create a labeled video from the *el.h5 file, do you observed the offset as well? Another question: do both animals disappear at the beginning or end of the video?

@ldavr - I guess Jessy means can you run `create_labeled_video` (next tab, as the "refinement" is purely optional now); you already have the H5 so you can run create_labeled_video and plot_trajectories; curious if it gives you the same "wrong length" error
@MMathisLab and @jeylau Ah, my bad. Yes, I tried this as well before and tried again now and do not see the same offset. The video looks perfect and no error message in the terminal either.
Sweet!! This has to be a bug specific to the refinement window then, I'll have a look 😊
okay great; bug isolated - thanks @ldavr :) hope it looks nice ;)

Awesome, thank you so much @jeylau and @MMathisLab ! Good to know it seems everything is then in order and I can move forward using the data as intended asap! Appreciate the time, and it does indeed look very nice ;)

rename.to: Offset tracklets vs. raw video in refinement GUI
